data.title: Hummer Trivia Questions and Answers
data.meta_description: Test your knowledge of the iconic Hummer brand with these 60 engaging trivia questions. Perfect for car enthusiasts and curious minds!
data.text:
1: What year was the Hummer brand first marketed for civilian use?

A: 1990

B: 1992

C: 1994

D: 1996

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The Hummer brand was first marketed in 1992 when AM General began selling a civilian version of the M998 Humvee.

2: Which celebrity famously pushed for the creation of a civilian Hummer after seeing an Army convoy?

A: Tom Cruise

B: Sylvester Stallone

C: Arnold Schwarzenegger

D: Bruce Willis

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Arnold Schwarzenegger saw an Army convoy while filming “Kindergarten Cop” and began lobbying for a civilian version of the Humvee to be available to the market.

3: What company originally produced the Hummer before General Motors?

A: Ford

B: AM General

C: Chrysler

D: Toyota

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: AM General originally produced the Hummer before selling the brand name to General Motors in 1999.

4: In which year did General Motors purchase the Hummer brand from AM General?

A: 1995

B: 1998

C: 1999

D: 2000

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: General Motors purchased the Hummer brand from AM General in 1999.

5: When did GM discontinue the Hummer brand due to declining demand and high fuel prices?

A: 2008

B: 2009

C: 2010

D: 2011

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: GM discontinued the Hummer brand in 2010 due to declining demand for large SUVs and high fuel prices.

6: How much did General Motors invest to build all-electric vehicles in their Detroit-Hamtramck assembly plant to revive the Hummer nameplate?

A: $1.5 billion

B: $2.2 billion

C: $2.8 billion

D: $3.0 billion

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: GM invested $2.2 billion to build a variety of all-electric vehicles, including the new GMC Hummer EV, in their Detroit-Hamtramck assembly plant.

7: Which platform did the Hummer H3 share with other GM vehicles?

A: GMT-900

B: Lambda

C: GMT-360

D: GMT-355

Correct Answer: D

Explanation: The Hummer H3 shared the GMT-355 platform with the Chevrolet Colorado and GMC Canyon compact pickup trucks.

8: What year did the last Hummer H3 roll off the assembly line, marking the initial end of Hummer production?

A: 2008

B: 2009

C: 2010

D: 2011

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The last Hummer H3 rolled off the assembly line on May 24, 2010, marking the initial end of Hummer production.

9: Who led the Hummer Team in off-road racing competitions such as the Baja 1000?

A: Robby Gordon

B: Ivan Stewart

C: Rod Hall

D: Larry Ragland

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Rod Hall led Team Hummer in off-road racing competitions, including the Baja 1000.

10: Which model was the smallest in the Hummer lineup?

A: H1

B: H2

C: H3

D: H4

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer H3 was the smallest model in the Hummer lineup, based on the GMT-355 platform.

11: Which year did Hummer make a comeback as an all-electric vehicle under the GMC brand?

A: 2020

B: 2021

C: 2022

D: 2023

Correct Answer: A

Explanation: The Hummer brand made a comeback as an all-electric vehicle under the GMC brand in 2020.

12: Which company expressed interest in purchasing the Hummer brand from GM during the economic downturn in 2008?

A: Tata Motors

B: Mahindra & Mahindra

C: Great Wall Motors

D: BYD Auto

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra expressed interest in purchasing the Hummer brand from GM in 2008.

13: What was the tagline for the series of commercials announcing the return of the Hummer as an electric vehicle?

A: “King of the Road”

B: “Electric Revolution”

C: “Quiet Revolution”

D: “Future Forward”

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The tagline for the series of commercials announcing the return of the Hummer as an electric vehicle was “Quiet Revolution.”

14: What was the estimated fuel economy of the Hummer H2 on the highway?

A: 8 mpg

B: 10 mpg

C: 12 mpg

D: 14 mpg

Correct Answer: D

Explanation: The Hummer H2 had an estimated fuel economy of 14 mpg on the highway.

15: Which country was the Hummer H3 exported to with right-hand drive versions?

A: Japan

B: United Kingdom

C: Australia

D: New Zealand

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer H3 was exported to Australia with right-hand drive versions.

16: In which year did GM announce plans to sell the Hummer brand to Sichuan Tengzhong Heavy Industrial Machinery Company Ltd.?

A: 2007

B: 2008

C: 2009

D: 2010

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: GM announced plans to sell the Hummer brand to Sichuan Tengzhong Heavy Industrial Machinery Company Ltd. in 2009.

17: Which vehicle was the first to be marketed as a civilian version of the military Humvee?

A: Hummer H1

B: Hummer H2

C: Hummer H3

D: Hummer HX

Correct Answer: A

Explanation: The Hummer H1 was the first vehicle to be marketed as a civilian version of the military Humvee.

18: What was the original name for the Hummer brand before it was called Hummer?

A: Humvee

B: Hummie

C: HummR

D: H3M

Correct Answer: A

Explanation: The original name for the Hummer brand was Humvee, which was later marketed as Hummer for civilian use.

19: Which GM facility was retooled to build future electric trucks and SUVs, including the Hummer EV, after the 2019 strike?

A: Detroit-Hamtramck

B: Lordstown

C: Fairfax

D: Arlington

Correct Answer: A

Explanation: The Detroit-Hamtramck facility was retooled to build future electric trucks and SUVs, including the Hummer EV, after the 2019 strike.

20: Which year was the Hummer H2 assembled in Kaliningrad, Russia, by Avtotor?

A: 2004

B: 2005

C: 2006

D: 2007

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer H2 was assembled in Kaliningrad, Russia, by Avtotor starting in 2006.

21: In which U.S. state was the Hummer H3 produced alongside the Chevrolet Colorado and GMC Canyon pickups?

A: Texas

B: Louisiana

C: Ohio

D: Michigan

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The Hummer H3 was produced in Shreveport, Louisiana, alongside the Chevrolet Colorado and GMC Canyon pickups.

22: Which model of Hummer was cut behind the cab and extended to create limousine versions?

A: H1

B: H2

C: H3

D: HX

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The Hummer H2 was cut behind the cab and extended to create various limousine versions.

23: What year marked the end of Hummer H1 production for civilian use?

A: 2004

B: 2005

C: 2006

D: 2007

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The production of the Hummer H1 for civilian use ceased in 2006.

24: Which organization did Team Hummer compete in under leader Rod Hall?

A: NASCAR

B: BITD and SCORE

C: WRC

D: IMSA

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: Team Hummer, led by Rod Hall, competed in the stock classes of BITD (Best in the Desert) and SCORE (Southern California Off-Road Enthusiasts) organizations.

25: How many production-class wins did Team Hummer achieve in the Baja 1000?

A: 5

B: 7

C: 9

D: 11

Correct Answer: D

Explanation: Team Hummer earned 11 production-class wins at the Baja 1000.

26: Which event was the Hummer EV pickup truck officially revealed?

A: Super Bowl

B: World Series

C: NCAA Tournament

D: Olympics

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The Hummer EV pickup truck was officially revealed during the 2020 World Series.

27: What feature distinguishes the Hummer HX prototype?

A: It is a plug-in hybrid

B: It is an open-air, two-door off-road concept car

C: It has a V12 engine

D: It is a fully autonomous vehicle

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The Hummer HX prototype is an open-air, two-door off-road concept car, smaller than other Hummer models.

28: In what year did the rumors begin about GM considering reviving the Hummer nameplate?

A: 2017

B: 2018

C: 2019

D: 2020

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: In mid-2019, rumors began to circulate that General Motors was considering reviving the Hummer nameplate.

29: Which Hummer model was developed as a hybrid with the E-REV powertrain technology similar to the Chevrolet Volt?

A: H1

B: H2

C: H3

D: HX

Correct Answer: D

Explanation: The Hummer HX was developed as a hybrid with the E-REV (Extended-Range Electric Vehicle) powertrain technology similar to the Chevrolet Volt.

30: When did the Hummer H2 production end?

A: 2008

B: 2009

C: 2010

D: 2011

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The production of the Hummer H2 ended in 2009.

31: How much was the price tag for the Hummer brand when Sichuan Tengzhong attempted to purchase it?

A: $100 million

B: $125 million

C: $150 million

D: $200 million

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The price tag for the Hummer brand was $150 million when Sichuan Tengzhong attempted to purchase it.

32: What is the special characteristic of the Hummer EV’s “Edition 1” model?

A: It is only available in red

B: It has a solar panel roof

C: It is the most expensive version

D: It has hydrogen fuel cells

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The “Edition 1” model of the Hummer EV is initially the most expensive version available.

33: What led to the declining value of the Hummer brand before its eventual shutdown?

A: Increase in electric vehicle popularity

B: High fuel prices and weak consumer demand

C: Advances in autonomous driving technology

D: Stricter environmental regulations

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: High fuel prices and weak consumer demand led to the declining value of the Hummer brand before its eventual shutdown.

34: What feature was notably missing in the Hummer H1 compared to other vehicles?

A: Automatic transmission

B: Airbags and stability control

C: All-wheel drive

D: Power steering

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The Hummer H1 lacked standard safety features like airbags and stability control, which are common in other vehicles.

35: What inspired the design of Hummer dealership buildings?

A: Space-age architecture

B: European car showrooms

C: The Hummer brand’s military origins

D: Traditional American barns

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Hummer dealership buildings featured an oversized half Quonset Hut style roof, themed to the Hummer brand’s military origins.

36: Which TV star was featured in the Super Bowl ad revealing the return of Hummers as electric vehicles?

A: Dwayne Johnson

B: Tom Brady

C: LeBron James

D: Serena Williams

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: NBA superstar LeBron James was featured in the Super Bowl ad revealing the return of Hummers as electric vehicles.

37: What is one common criticism of Hummers related to environmental concerns?

A: Lack of luxury interiors

B: Very poor fuel economy

C: Insufficient horsepower

D: No hybrid models

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: One common criticism of Hummers is their very poor fuel economy compared to other heavy passenger vehicles.

38: What was the function of the Hummer modified into stretch limousines?

A: Mobile office

B: Nightclub

C: Passenger section for 14-22 passengers

D: Transporting military personnel

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer H2 was modified into stretch limousines with a passenger section for 14, 16, or even 22 passengers.

39: In which racing event did Team Hummer achieve notable success?

A: Daytona 500

B: Indianapolis 500

C: Baja 1000

D: 24 Hours of Le Mans

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Team Hummer achieved notable success in the Baja 1000, with numerous production-class wins.

40: What led to the potential Chinese buyer’s difficulty in purchasing the Hummer brand?

A: Lack of investor interest

B: Regulatory approval from the Chinese government

C: Competition from other bidders

D: Declining global SUV market

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: Sichuan Tengzhong faced difficulty in purchasing the Hummer brand due to issues with obtaining regulatory approval from the Chinese government.

41: What new feature did the GMC Hummer EV introduce for off-road capabilities?

A: Solar-powered charging

B: Autonomous driving

C: CrabWalk mode

D: Hydrogen fuel cells

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The GMC Hummer EV introduced CrabWalk mode, a feature enhancing off-road capabilities by enabling diagonal movement.

42: Where did the production of H3 models for international markets take place starting in October 2006?

A: Detroit, Michigan

B: Shreveport, Louisiana

C: Port Elizabeth, South Africa

D: Kaliningrad, Russia

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Production of H3 models for international markets began in Port Elizabeth, South Africa, starting in October 2006.

43: What was a primary reason for GM considering reevaluation or sale of Hummer in 2008?

A: Increasing competition from Japanese automakers

B: Decreasing demand for large SUVs and higher oil prices

C: Introduction of new car safety regulations

D: Development of new hybrid technology

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: GM considered reevaluating or selling Hummer in 2008 due to decreasing demand for large SUVs and higher oil prices.

44: Which racing event sees Robby Gordon race a highly modified, two-wheel drive Hummer?

A: Pikes Peak International Hill Climb

B: Dakar Rally

C: King of the Hammers

D: Formula Drift

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: Robby Gordon raced a highly modified, two-wheel drive Hummer in the Dakar Rally.

45: What is the website for the revived Hummer models under the GMC brand?

A: hummer.com

B: gmchummer.com

C: gmc.com/hummer-ev

D: electric-hummer.com

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The website for the revived Hummer models is gmc.com/hummer-ev.

46: What unique design element is shared by many Hummer dealership buildings?

A: Gothic arches

B: Spherical windows

C: Half Quonset Hut style roof

D: Glass ceilings

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Many Hummer dealership buildings featured an oversized half Quonset Hut style roof, reflecting the brand’s military origins.

47: Which actor bought the first two civilian Hummer H1s sold?

A: Sylvester Stallone

B: Tom Cruise

C: Arnold Schwarzenegger

D: Nicolas Cage

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Arnold Schwarzenegger bought the first two Hummer H1s sold.

48: In which international automobile event was the Hummer HX prototype unveiled?

A: Frankfurt Motor Show

B: Tokyo Motor Show

C: Detroit Auto Show

D: Geneva Motor Show

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer HX prototype was unveiled at the Detroit Auto Show.

49: What year did GM begin producing the Hummer H3 at its Port Elizabeth plant in South Africa?

A: 2004

B: 2005

C: 2006

D: 2007

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: GM began producing the Hummer H3 at its Port Elizabeth plant in South Africa in 2006.

50: Which type of powertrain did the prototype developed by Raser Technologies use?

A: Hydrogen fuel cell

B: E-REV (Extended-Range Electric Vehicle)

C: Pure electric

D: Turbo diesel

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The prototype developed by Raser Technologies used the E-REV (Extended-Range Electric Vehicle) powertrain.

51: Which type of vehicle did the Hummer H1 derive from?

A: M1 Abrams

B: M998 Humvee

C: Jeep Wrangler

D: Land Rover Defender

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: The Hummer H1 was derived from the military M998 Humvee.

52: What was the reason GM’s CEO stated in 2009 for discontinuing the Hummer brand?

A: Decreasing demand for large SUVs and high fuel prices

B: Failure to merge with another company

C: Increased competition from hybrid vehicles

D: Insufficient production capacity

Correct Answer: A

Explanation: GM’s CEO stated that decreasing demand for large SUVs and high fuel prices were reasons for discontinuing the Hummer brand.

53: What was the proposed method for Sichuan Tengzhong to possibly acquire the Hummer brand after the deal collapse in 2010?

A: Public stock offering

B: Private equity investment fund

C: Joint venture with GM

D: Crowd-funding campaign

Correct Answer: B

Explanation: There were reports that Sichuan Tengzhong might pursue acquiring the Hummer brand through a private equity investment fund.

54: What year did the Hummer H2 Assembly Plant in Mishawaka, Indiana, open?

A: 2000

B: 2001

C: 2002

D: 2003

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer H2 Assembly Plant in Mishawaka, Indiana, opened in 2002.

55: What was the primary criticism of Hummers regarding parking and driving in urban environments?

A: High cost of maintenance

B: Poor acceleration

C: Large size and difficulty maneuvering

D: Limited cargo space

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Hummers, specifically the H1 and H2, faced criticism for their large size, which caused problems with parking and driving in urban environments.

56: Which market was believed to help with lower marketing costs due to established name recognition when reviving the Hummer brand?

A: European market

B: Asian market

C: Off-road vehicle market

D: Luxury SUV market

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer brand’s established name recognition in the off-road vehicle market was believed to help reduce marketing costs when reviving the brand.

57: What major automotive event in 2020 featured the unveiling of the Hummer EV SUV?

A: Super Bowl

B: Tokyo Motor Show

C: NCAA Tournament Final Four

D: Geneva Motor Show

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: The Hummer EV SUV was unveiled during the NCAA Tournament Final Four on April 3, 2021.

58: In which location was Hummer H3 production performed specifically for international markets besides the U.S.?

A: Sao Paulo, Brazil

B: Ontario, Canada

C: Port Elizabeth, South Africa

D: Madrid, Spain

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: Hummer H3 production for international markets was performed in Port Elizabeth, South Africa.

59: GM planned to build a variety of electric trucks and SUVs under which architecture?

A: GMT-900

B: Lambda

C: BT1 electric truck platform

D: Omega

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: GM planned to build a variety of electric trucks and SUVs, including the Hummer EV, under the BT1 electric truck platform.
